threat: This could allow a remote attacker to open connections to certain hosts that should not be permitted.
This could allow a remote attacker to view confidential data.
A remote attacker could use this to cause an untrusted application or applet to execute arbitrary code by deserializing malicious input.
This could allow a remote attacker to cause an untrusted application or applet to execute arbitrary code with the full privileges of the JVM.
An attacker could possibly use this to gain access to sensitive information.
A remote attacker could cause an untrusted application or applet to execute arbitrary code.
A remote attacker could use this cause a denial of service via an application or applet crash or possibly execute arbitrary code.

A remote attacker could use this with a malicious application or applet exhaust the number of available UDP sockets to cause a denial of service for other applets or applications running within the same JVM.
A remote attacker could potentially use this to gain access to sensitive information.
An attacker could cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code through a specially crafted pack200 JAR file.
A remote attacker could use this to execute code with elevated privileges.
It was discovered that the HotSpot VM could be made to crash, allowing an attacker to cause a denial of service or possibly leak sensitive information.
This could allow a remote attacker to bypass restrictions on HTTPS connections.
